Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Project: Linguistic analysis of infant- and child-directed speech in one’s first and second languages.
Duties: Coordinated the recruitment of bilingual families among community partners
Coordinated and supervised the data collection of bilingual parents and infants and managed data curation.
Mentored undergraduate students

Research experience.Lab: Language and Brain Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Project: Adaptations in conversation: engaging voices, faces, brains and machines.
Duties: Used Linear Mixed Effects Models to analyze vowel acoustics
Mentored undergraduate and graduate students

Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Project: L2 English learners' phonetic adaptation to non-native accents.
Research experience.Role: Student lead, Doctoral trainee of NSERC Discovery Grant
Duties: Conducted literature review, developed research questions and hypotheses
Designed online experiment platform for perception studies using JsPschy
Created scripts in MatLab to generate acoustic continuums for fricatives using Tandem-STRAIGHT
Collected and curated speech perception and production data from 420 native English speakers and Mandarin learners of English in Canada and China
Used Generalized Linear Mixed Effects Models to analyze perception data and performed Linear Discriminant Analysis on acoustics.
Developed a doctoral dissertation, 3 first-author manuscripts (1 submitted, 2 in preparation) and 2 conference presentations.

Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab & Language and Brain Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.PI/Co-Is: Dr. Henny Yeung, Dr. Yue Wang
Duties: Conducted literature review, developed research questions and hypotheses
Designed auditory stimuli in Mandarin and recorded visual stimuli
Coordinated and supervised the data collection of eye-tracking data from 72 monolingual English and bilingual English-Mandarin speakers.
Used Linear Mixed Effects Models to analyze fixation proportions, saccade amplitude and fixation latency, conducted Growth Curve Analysis on eye-gaze patterns
Mentored undergraduate students
Developed 3 first-author manuscripts (1 published, 1 in revision, 1 in preparation) and 2 conference presentations.

Research experience.Lab: The Language Production Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Projects: Simon Fraser University Speech Error Database, Digital Annotated Speech Error Bibliography.
Duties: Used Montreal Forced Aligner to annotate speech production data
Coded references of speech error research for a digital library
Mentored undergraduate students

Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Project: Processing tone and vowel information in Mandarin: An eye-tracking study of contextual effects on speech processing.
Research experience.Role: Student lead, graduate trainee of NSERC Discovery Grant
Duties: Conducted literature review, developed research questions and hypotheses
Designed an eye-tracking experiment using ExperimentBuilder, EyeLink and MatLab
Collected and curated eye-tracking data from 24 native  Mandarin speakers
Conducted Growth Curve Analysis on the eye-fixation data.
Developed a master thesis, 1 first-author manuscript (published) and 1 conference presentation.

Research experience.Lab: Language Learning and Development Lab, Simon Fraser University, Canada
Research experience.Project: Foreign language learning and the perception of musical rhythm and melody.
Duties: Conducted literature review, developed research questions and hypotheses
Coordinated and supervised the data collection of perception and production data from 20 monolingual English speakers and 45 Mandarin learners of English.
Used Linear Mixed Effects Models to analyze the perception of musical sub-domains and English lexical stress
Mentored undergraduate students
Developed 1 first-author manuscript (in preparation) and 2 conference presentations.
